messages: 87060801c8c613f3f8b763c9608da072 (19:47): if im programming, and after pressing enter the cursor is at the same indent as the start of the previous line (good thing), and then i press # for a comment, the cursor goes back to the beginning of the line:(. how can i make it stay where it is
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (19:48): grep the help for 'inoremap #'
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (19:50): or just :set nosmartindent
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (19:51): then you lose other useful indent stuff
87060801c8c613f3f8b763c9608da072 (19:51): ciaranm, ill check the help

cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (20:01): dmsantam: But comments starting at the beginning of a line are actually sane
ade2ba280c823b6462a992b994ecd802 (20:01): not always
ade2ba280c823b6462a992b994ecd802 (20:01): depends on the language
87060801c8c613f3f8b763c9608da072 (20:02): daniel, when im 3 levels in the code, why would i want my comment at the very beginning of the line?
87060801c8c613f3f8b763c9608da072 (20:02): i want them at the same indent level as the code it is talking about
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (20:03): dmsantam: Because comments are not at the logic indenting level of code
87060801c8c613f3f8b763c9608da072 (20:03): daniel, maybe yours aren't
87060801c8c613f3f8b763c9608da072 (20:04): daniel, but if a comment is talking about a line of code that is 3 indents in, i want it at the same indent
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (20:04): actually... the # thing is not for comments. it's for c preprocessor stuff
87060801c8c613f3f8b763c9608da072 (20:04): ciaranm, in perl its comments
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (20:04): the reason # goes to column 0 is because some compilers ignore it
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (20:04): dmsantam: that is not why the # goes unindented
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (20:04): but that's the reason vim does it for you
87060801c8c613f3f8b763c9608da072 (20:04): tpope, yeah, makes sense for C
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (20:05): the vi (not vim) indent modes are based around c
